title: Hillel and the Convert
desc: A potential convert asks Hillel to teach him the whole Torah while standing on one foot.

title: Kamtza and Bar Kamtza
desc: The tragic story of a party invitation gone wrong that led to the destruction of Jerusalem.

title: The Oven of Akhnai
desc: The Sages debate God Himself, proving that the Torah is 'not in Heaven' but in the hands of man.

title: Honi the Circle Maker
desc: Honi sleeps for 70 years and wakes up to a world that no longer recognizes him.

title: Rabbi Akiva's Beginning
desc: How a poor shepherd became the greatest scholar thanks to the sacrifice of his wife, Rachel.

title: Resh Lakish and Rabbi Yochanan
desc: A bandit becomes a scholar after a chance meeting in the Jordan River, but a tragic argument ends in heartbreak.

title: Moses in Rabbi Akiva's Classroom
desc: Moses time-travels to see Rabbi Akiva teaching and is humbled by what he sees.

title: The Man Who Tempted the Nazir
desc: Shimon HaTzaddik meets a beautiful shepherd who chooses to cut his hair for God.

title: Turn Back, Meir
desc: Rabbi Meir learns Torah from the heretic Elisha ben Abuyah, even as he rides a horse on Shabbat.

title: Hillel in the Snow
desc: A poor Hillel climbs to the roof of the study hall to listen to Torah in the freezing cold.

title: The Four Who Entered Pardes
desc: Four great Sages enter a mystical orchard; only Rabbi Akiva emerges unscathed.

title: Rabbi Shimon in the Cave
desc: Fleeing Roman execution, Rabbi Shimon bar Yochai and his son hide in a cave for 12 years.

title: The Repentance of Elazar ben Durdaya
desc: A man known for visiting every prostitute in the world realizes he must save his own soul.

title: Nahum Ish Gamzu
desc: The teacher of Rabbi Akiva who accepted every misfortune with the phrase, 'This too is for the good.'

title: Wine in Earthen Vessels
desc: Rabbi Yehoshua teaches the Emperor's daughter that wisdom, like wine, keeps best in humble vessels.

title: The Messiah at the Gates of Rome
desc: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi finds the Messiah among the beggars and asks him when he is coming.

title: The Handmaid's Prayer
desc: While the Sages pray for Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi to live, his servant prays for his suffering to end.

title: The Jokers of the Market
desc: Elijah the Prophet reveals that two comedians are the most deserving of the World to Come.

title: Alexander at the Gates of Eden
desc: Alexander the Great demands entry to Paradise but receives a human eyeball that outweighs all his gold.

title: The Ugly Man
desc: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon insults an ugly man, only to be told: 'Go tell the Craftsman who made me how ugly I am.'

title: Rav Preida's Patience
desc: A teacher who taught a student the same lesson 400 times (and then 400 times again) is rewarded by God.

title: The Miracle of the Vinegar
desc: When his daughter mistakes vinegar for oil on Shabbat, Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa says: 'He who commanded oil to burn will command vinegar to burn.'

title: Titus and the Gnat
desc: After destroying the Temple and challenging God, Titus is tortured for years by a gnat buzzing in his brain.

title: How to Respect One's Parents
desc: A gentile loses a fortune because he refuses to wake his sleeping father to retrieve a key.

title: How To Respect Your Mother
desc: Rabbi Tarfon acts as a footstool for his elderly mother, yet the Sages tell him he hasn't done enough.

title: Rav Huna's Sour Wine
desc: When Rav Huna loses 400 barrels of wine, the Sages urge him to examine his actions rather than blame bad luck.

title: All for the Best
desc: Rabbi Akiva is stranded in the woods as his lamp, rooster, and donkey are killed, only to realize it saved him from capture.

title: King David and the Angel of Death
desc: King David learns he will die on Shabbat, so he studies Torah non-stop to prevent the Angel of Death from touching him.

title: Herod Kills All the Rabbis Except One
desc: King Herod kills all the Rabbis except Bava ben Buta, whom he blinds, only to later regret it and ask for a way to atone.

title: Hillel's Patience
desc: Two men bet money on whether one can make Hillel angry; despite many interruptions, Hillel remains calm.

title: Rabbi Yehuda and the Calf
desc: Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi suffers for years because he showed no mercy to a calf being taken to slaughter.

title: Rabbi Akiva's Daughter
desc: Astrologers predict Rabbi Akiva's daughter will die on her wedding day, but her act of charity saves her from a snake.

title: King Solomon and Ashmedai, the King of the Demons
desc: After being overthrown by the demon Ashmedai, King Solomon wanders the land claiming to be king, but no one believes him.

title: Rabbi Chanina and the Lizard
desc: Rabbi Chanina proves that it is not the lizard (arvad) that kills, but sin that kills, by placing his heel over its hole.

title: Rav Amram and the Ladder
desc: To stop himself from sinning with a captive woman, Rav Amram moves a heavy ladder and shouts 'Fire in Amramâ€™s house!' to shame his own impulse.

title: Mar Ukva's Charity
desc: Mar Ukva and his wife hide inside a hot oven to avoid shaming a poor man they were secretly giving money to.

title: Yosef Who Honors Shabbat
desc: A wealthy neighbor sells his estate to avoid it going to Yosef, but the proceeds (a pearl) end up in a fish on Yosef's Shabbat table.
